Reviews.Title: “very good and clean”
Reviews.Author: Michanova
Reviews.Content: very good hotel , friendly stuff, clean and good location

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but could do with a refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: adrian_bruder
Reviews.Content: We got the hotel as part of a City Breaks deal including the flights for 2 adults and 2 kids so relatively cheap. The hotel had everything it needed inclusive of a severe Receptionist who looked most of the time quite upset..but we did not spend much time looking at her..Barcelona is splendid so we spend a lot of time outside only returning for a night sleep.Breakfast was not something to write home about but sufficient and OK. Pay more if you want more..otherwise quite acceptable for relatively cheap place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Laila T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 2 times and its just amazing, location is good, rooms are spacious and very clean, breakfast is great and staffs are nice and helpful , do not hesitate to book it !

Reviews.Title: “good location but decor is very suburban”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAustraliaGreg
Reviews.Content: compared to the swish Axel hotel and others close by the HCC Taber needs a lick of paint and a smart interior designer to give this place an overhaul.Decor was very "old Nana " given the area has contemporary art galleries and chic cafes nearby . Some staff were great others diffident and rude .Internet access in the basement cafe was exorbitant given free internet access at many hotels in Spain

Reviews.Title: “Great three star, pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: loobyloo66
Reviews.Content: We were not expecting much from a three star hotel in Spain and were so pleased when we arrived. It is very clean, and the staff so helpful, printing maps etc from the internet, nothing was too much trouble. I lost my watch in the room, the maid must have found it and left it on the bedside table for me. The continental breakfast was more than adequate. Fresh fruit and pastries every day, selection of cheeses and hams, cereals and juices. We never left hungry. Aircon and hairdryers in the rooms and a fridge. No kettle for tea and coffee and we did not have a great view from our balcony but this was to be expected. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth thhe price”
Reviews.Author: kim-ohradiogirl
Reviews.Content: Walked In off the street and got this room at 95€ + tax (which was 2€ cheaper than online). Glad that they had a room. Clean too, but the towels are like sandpaper and there's no face towel. The bed is not very comfortable. Interestingly, there's an exercise bike in the room. No wifi in the room though, but wired Internet access; not good for me since I have an iPad. Also, the free wifi in the lobby and bar area, you have to get a password which is fine, but they could have told us that at check in. Finally, there's a buffet for 17€; I won't be writing about that since it's out of my price range. Oh, nice location since there's lots of restaurants and shopping nearby.

Reviews.Title: “We would definelty stay again!”
Reviews.Author: 5Dpenn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I,along with another couple stayed at the Taber a couple of nights before boarding our cruise ship. The staff at the hotel desk were more than helpful! They helped with directions and locating diferent sites on the map and even made reservations for us for several dinner shows. We arrived a little early before our rooms were available and so we locked our luggage in their store room and had no problems there,felt very safe to us. The rooms were more than large enough,our room was a little stuffy compared to our friends room,but was manageable. My husband and I stayed another night after our cruise shipped docked and enjoyued the sites of Barcelona again!!! I would highly recommend this hotel. Another plus, you are just one block from The Rambla!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very central and convenient for discovering Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: gerardhcollet
Reviews.Content: Very central hotel close to underground station, just a few stops from the airport (no change). Walking distance from the Ramblas with many restaurants and shops all around. We stayed in room 603 (6th floor) in the front of the hotel,our choice, we wanted a view. The traffic can be noisy but we had our earplugs and the double glazing is efficient, pleasant room with aircon and all modern facilities. We stayed 4 nights so breakfast can be repetitive but very acceptable and confortable. A very enjoyable stay and we will certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: footiefan10
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Taber for 3 nights from 25 March 2011. I booked the hotel through Air Miles and it more than lived up to my expectations. Our flight landed around 5 pm and we decided to take the train into Barcelona rather than getting a taxi. The train cost 6 euro 15 cents and took about 30 mins. We got off at Passeig de Gracia and the hotel is only a couple of minutes walk. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and soon had us checked in. We hired a safe box at a cost of 5 euro a night which I dont think is too bad. We were on the second floor and had a double room with a small room to the side with a single bed in. We were overlooking the main road but noise was not a problem. The room was very nice and clean and there was maid service daily. The only thing that was missing was tea and coffee making facilities which are usually included in hotel rooms. The breakfasts were buffet style - cereals, yoghurts, cold meats and plenty of pastries and the staff in the breakfast room were very friendly. The hotel is well placed for sightseeing - just a couple of minutes walk from Casa Batllo and about a 10 minute stroll to Plaza de Catalunya and the sight seeing buses. We also strolled down the Ramblas to the Port area which is also well worth a visit, We did the sight seeing bus - we bought a 2 day ticket which was well worth the money 30 euro as opposed to 23 euro for a one day ticket. We also did the Nou Camp stadium and took the cable car across the harbour which was fab - 10 euro for a 1 way journey. Park Guell is brilliant and another must do. We also liked Port Vell and the marina and managed to take in a stroll on the beach as it was t shirt weather. There are some lovely Tapas restaurants just minutes from the hotel. We had a fab time and would definately return to Barcelona and this hotel. We took the aero bus back to the airport - it was slightly more expensive than the train but only a couple of euros more but it only took about 15 minutes. You pick up the bus in the plaza de catalunya and they run every 10 mins or so

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, ideally situated.”
Reviews.Author: Pixel8ted
Reviews.Content: We cashed in our Airmiles account on a 4 day break in Barcelona. Although this hotel was one of the cheapest of the package hotels offered, its location looked to be perfect for exploring the city. We were right. The hotel was very clean and bright and the staff were helpful. Our room was on the 3 floor at one side of the building. Large and clean, with comfortable beds and a good size bathroom. The free WiFi did not seem to be working, but the Hotel lent me an ethernet cable to connect to the internet. We had breakfast included in our package deal, the choice of food was the same each day, but as we were only staying 4 days the convenience of breakfast in the hotel was more important for us. The location was exactly what we needed. Easy walk to Place de Catalunya, and near to several must see buildings. A metro station is one block away, and with lots of good restaurants around we found this hotel offered everything we wanted for a great city break.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Beeffinder
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 9 days and it was clean with good size rooms and all the usual stuff. Staff were nice. The only disappointment was the breakfast but then i find most mainland European hotels (the reasonable priced ones that is) have below-par continental selection. However there was nothing much wrong with it, it just didn't have the bits i would want. Walls were a bit thin but it didn't cause me any sleeping problems I'd happily stay here again. I can't comment on value as i was staying on business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowRobbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Taber for one night pre-cruise from Barcelona. Staff welcoming at check in, and room allocated very clean and comfortable. Our room was at the front of the hotel, on the main road, so there was a bit of road noise but not enough to keep us awake. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as the buffet on offer was too expensive. We ate at a nearby cafe at half the price. Have stayed here on a previous occasion, and would definitely stay again due to its location.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, fantastic air con!”
Reviews.Author: The_traveling_gypsy
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much. we decided to pay a little bit extra to stay in an airconditioned hotel instead of the baking hot hostel we first booked. This was well worth the extra money! The beds were very comfy, the room was clean and serviced daily, the air con very efective and we had a mini-bar in the room. There are plenty of restraunts, shops and a metro station close by, however the beach is about a 30 minute walk away and La Ramblas is about a 10-15 minute walk. We were directed to this hotel by the tourist office, who gave us a much better price then the hotel offered! There is a parking station next door that charges 27 Euro per day, this was the best/closest parking we could find.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but air conditioning sucks!”
Reviews.Author: barkoutloud
Reviews.Content: Location and price are great, but rooms have very bad Air conditioning. On a hot summer day you want to return to a nice and cool room, and that's clearly not the case with this hotel. Even after having complained about it at front desk, they said they would send a technician to check it out, but when we returned to the hotel that night, there was still practically warm air slightly blowing. There is a better HCC, that does have working A/C just a few blocks away and it's cheaper too (book at the central train station at the tourist info. desk and they get the best rates for you there!)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with access.”
Reviews.Author: ArturR
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in Barcelona, and the staff of Taber did a great job for us. This is not the most expensive in the city, but provides the minimum necessary amenities. Just a few doors from La Rambla Cataluña, with easy access to the Metro and buses, it is very easy to "people watch" or participate in the culture. I recommend this to anyone wishing for a good value for their euor.

Reviews.Title: “...”
Reviews.Author: nick_bary
Reviews.Content: We staied with my friends all 12 of us for 10 days. We selected this hotel because it is next to la rambla and the underground. The rooms were ok althought we found a smoked cigarette hinden in the closet, but we can't blame the stuff, Generally the hotel was clean and the rooms too. The stuff was very helpful with us, with the exeption of the lady who was serving the breakfast. She was really nervous and sometimes rude, as if we shouldn't touch the buffet. the free wirless internet was really helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: schakarova
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice situated. Two of Gaudi houses are on a minute -two walking distance. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Nothing special. Typical for city and 3 star hotel. Staff is very friendly! Thank you! The price of the breakfast is overpriced. Breakfast in nearby restaurants is cheaper than in the hotel. The only negative thing reffering rooms is that all of them looking to the main street are very very noisy. If is possible choose backyard room.

Reviews.Title: “I really like this hotel, Prefer it over many others.”
Reviews.Author: ArturR
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times since June, 2000, the staff is always courteous, went out of their way to assist me in locating friends in another city. It is clean, next to La Rambla, their food is quite good and plentiful. This is my hotel of choice for Barcelona. Although the "date of stay" does not cover the times I was there, I stayed in June of 2000 and June of 2003, both times it was an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very small single”
Reviews.Author: travelling_teena
Reviews.Content: Good hotel if you're only in BCN for a short period, want to be centrally located with quick access to the Metro, AND if you think paying for the above is worth that. I had booked a single room for one night - being off-season the price was ~70EU. My room was an odd-shaped retangular, half-room - it had a full-size bed flush to the wall and a nightstand next to it and then the opposite wall - so someone 6 ft tall could probably stretch his arms across and touch opposing walls. They managed to add a small desk with a television - but if you sit at the desk to work on your laptop, there's not much space. The bathroom was decent sized and hot water worked well. Overall the place was clean. If you're a single traveller they will probably stick you in this room, it can be tolerated for a night, but not for more than 2 nights, because you start thinking that you're paying a lot and there's probably better values found elsewhere. (The rate does not include breakfast) However, the hotel is next to Rumbla de Catalunya and 1 1/2 blocks from the ritzy stores of Passeig de Gracia - where if you turn right, you're at Casa Battlo and if you turn left and walk for 2 blocks you're at La Pedrera.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: trawellingstrawberry
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Friday until Sunday. I booked the hotel at the last minute in what seems to be a busy week-end in Barcelona, so I ended up paying 100 EUR a night for a single room, but I see that you can get these rooms for about 70 EUR usually. My room was nice, clean and located on the top floor, with a big terrace and really good view. Staff was in general friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was perfect, in the best shopping area (at least for me) and about 10 minutes walk from Las Ramblas. 5 minutes to the nearest sub-way. Would definitely come back. Btw, I have seen some comments here about hard mattresses, this was true but I prefer those to the ones that are too soft!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ruscopeco
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the HCC Taber for 4 nights.....Great location! The hotel is situated a short walk away from La Ramblas and offers good comfortable stay for anyone. I cannot fault the cleanliness of the hotel. My only disappointment, was the lack of enthusiasm from the front desk. Ideal hotel for a short city break.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND A VERY NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DLODRATSAB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Taber for one night on Saturday 25th July while visiting family in Spain .I had checked Tripadvisor reviews as always and was not disappointed .The location is excellent and very central being about 5-6 minutes walk from the top of the Ramblas .Check-in was breeze and our room on the 6th floor was large and very clean .It also had a seating area with a television and an exercise bike. Our rate included buffet breakfast which was to a good standard with all the normal cold meats ,cheeses and pastries .I will certainly use this very nice hotel on my next visit to this beautiful city .My only slight complaint is that unlike most hotels who have a in-room safe in which you put in a code and is free ,the Taber has one with a key which cost 5 Euros ,I am not sure if this amount per night as we only stayed one night or for any length of stay .I would have no hesitation in recommending this very fine hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central location.”
Reviews.Author: juliejos
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel, and were well pleased with our choice. The rooms were spotlessly clean and relatively comfortable. The beds were extremely hard, but as I have a bad back, this suited me. We asked for a room on the street side, as previous reviews have commented that the rooms at the back of the hotel were dark and had no natural light. Our room had 2 small balconies and overlooked the busy street, which was noisy, but if the balcony doors were closed was not a problem. Breakfast was good, with a good choice of fruit, bread, cold meat etc. Coffee was a bit cold, but we were given fresh as soon as we asked. All the staff that we met were polite and helpful. Location was good, we had been a little concerned that we might be a bit far away from the attractions, but this wasn't the case. After visiting La Rambla and the Barri Gotic, we were quite glad that we had opted for the location that we had. Excellent restaurants within a 5 minute walk, VERY expensive shops, ( Oh how the other half live!!) and not too far from anywhere. My only minor whinge about the hotel would be that the air-conditionong was not terribly effective.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLadytraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel as far as the location is concerned. But that's about all there is that is good to say about this dump. Our shower leaked, and the light in the bathroom wouldn't go on and they refused to fix it! They moved us to a new room the following day but it was smaller and had no window! Well a small window with no light because it looked into an alley. And when we asked for an adjustment on our room rate, they said no. Do yourself a favour and don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Quick City Break”
Reviews.Author: Emma D
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, the only complaints where- breakfast wasnt included in our price and was 19euros each if you wanted it and room service was pretty pricy and not much choice, So we declined and went to a few of the lovely cafes close by. Our room had a tiny balcony which was really lovely and allowed us to appreciate the city scape at night. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: scotrompol
Reviews.Content: Very handy location for getting to/from the airport (take train from the airport to Passeig de Gracia and literally a 2 minute walk from there) Very helpful staff at check in - esp younger lady with glasses (sorry can't remember name). Gave plenty of advice on location of sites and nothing was too much of a problem. Room was good. Quiet, beds comfortable and had light-blocking blinds - had the best sleep for ages and woke refreshed in the morning!! Room was to the back, so no view, but as it overlooks a main street, its probably better to have rear room as it's quieter. Breakfasts were good - although rotating toaster took a bit of getting used to!

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean, Affordable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GamebirdGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Barcelona to discover our 'luxury' apt in Las Ramblas was a slum! We were a group of 8 ladies who found ourselves stranded with nowhere to stay. We contacted the tourist information who found this lovely hotel and the rest of our trip was just wonderful. The Hotel staff were 1st class and helpful. The bedrooms were clean and spacious. The location could not have been better, central for everything. We would definately stay here again and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: portsmouthboy
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a stay in Barcelona. We have stayed in an HCC hotel on a previous visit but it was full when we booked so we booked another in the group. TheTaber hotel is perfect for a short sightseeing break. It is within 5 minutes walk of the Plaza Catalunia and a number of the other sights of the city. The Bus Touristic is a must to see all of the main sights of Barcelona and you can get on and off when you want. The Taber is on a busy road so rooms to the front of the hotel could be noisy with the window open, but the double glazing does work very well. The hotel is very clean, rooms are serviced every day to a very high standard. Our room was to the side of the building and due to the tall building next door did not have a lot of natural light but this did keep the room cool, we didn't need to use the aircon. The rooms are very well decorated and furnishing are comfortable and of a high standard. The breakfast buffet is very good with plenty of choice,but you do need to ask for the hot cooked option which does not take long to appear. All the staff are very friendly and efficient with all of them speaking good English. We would not hesitate to return to this hotel when in Barcelona again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowBibliotecaria
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Taber for 6 nights earlier this month, and overall, were very happy with the service provided. The reception, breakfast room and housekeeping staff could not have been more helpful - tourists should note that a smile and some attempts at Spanish, however poor, go a long way. Our non-smoking room was clean and everything worked. There was no information about the safe though, which you pay 4 euro a day for. We also had to ask for the bed linen to be changed after 4 days. I thought that most hotels did this every day, but perhaps not in Spain. It wasn't an issue anyway - we left a note for the housekeeping staff and they were changed right away. Problem solved. It did get a bit noisy being in a room close to the stairwell, but not to the point where we couldn't sleep, and that was the fault of the other guests and not the hotel. Breakfast was a continental buffet style, staff were pleasant and polite and very tolerant when people (like us) turned up 10 minutes before they stopped serving. The food was good - a wide range of fresh bread, cheese, meats, fruit, cereals, pastries. It was included when we booked, otherwise I might have been tempted to find cheaper alternatives. As it was paid for though, we enjoyed it and it was convenient to have it there in the hotel. The Taber's location was excellent. We spent a lot of time down in the Barri Gotic, but it was good to escape to the slightly quieter end of town when the day was done. The hotel is a short walk from the main square Placa de Catalunya, and they have a room where you can store your luggage after checkout if you have a while before your flight. All in all, a great hotel and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: MtnBrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HCC Taber for three nights in June. I would definitely recommend this hotel. We had a quiet room facing a courtyard. Our room was clean, comfortable and pleasant. We were able to get a non-smoking room. The rooms were comfortably air-conditioned and odor-free. The reception area was very modern. Although the hotel apparently has free WiFi, if you do not have your own laptop internet access was fairly expensive. After dark, there is a security guard stationed at the door which increased our sense of safety. Perhaps the best thing about the hotel was its excellent location. The streets around the hotel are very busy during the day but are relatively quiet at night. (I definitely would not want to stay at any hotel located in the Raval.) The HCC Taber is a block from a major metro station that offers train access to the airport. It is situated less than half a block from the start of La Rambla and is a ten minute walk down La Rambla to Place de Catalunya. One of the best shopping streets in Barcelona, Passeig de Gracia, is only one block away (running parallel to La Rambla). This means that there are many restaurants, cafes, pastry shops and clothing stores nearby. The two major hop on hop off tour bus companies both have stops on Passeig de Gracia about 2-3 blocks from the hotel, which was also very convenient. I would definitely stay at the HCC Taber again and would highly recommend it. Excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “neither professional nor friendly”
Reviews.Author: birosana
Reviews.Content: I went to 6 different hotels in spain for 2 weeks, this is only hotel I hated among them. When we got into our room in HCC taber, it was so obvious that some people just smoked in the room right before we arrived, even though it was a non-smoking room. The strong cigarette smell instantly gave my mom headache. We asked for a new room, then problems after another. The desk people didn't know how to say sorry, how to smile or how to be willing to help. The location is good, the room is pretty clean, but the breakfast also was the worst. I've been to big hotels in big cities with professional service, and to small hotels in small cities with friendly service if not professional. The desk service in HCC taber was neither professional nor friendly. I feel sorry for the people who hire them

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: BosGrl
Reviews.Content: The HCC Taber is a simple, clean hotel with a modern feel in a great part of the city. It's a 5-minute walk to Passig de Gracia (La Pedrera) or Placa Catalunya (and La Rambla), and the immediate neighborhood offers plenty of food, drink and shopping options. We enjoyed sitting at nearby outdoor cafes in the evening, and even found a local market for fruit in the morning. As for the hotel itself, the rooms are on the small side and have few extras (breakfast only included with some rooms, no pool or premium cable, etc), but everything is new and, as I said before, very clean. Prices were surprisingly reasonable for the area, too. Long story short, this is a good place for those looking for an inexpensive hotel near the sites and away from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “A Standard 'group' hotel - but friendly with it”
Reviews.Author: trueblueother
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in between Christmas and Newyear. I always stay in the Eixample district - good shops, bits of park, really good public transport links to everywhere. This is the first time I have used a standard 3star group hotel in BCN. I got exactly what I get in similar UK chain hotels. I had a single room - which was quite small (but adequate) the obligatory massive TV, very good ensuite facilities and the usual toiletries. Clean, well decorated, cleaned/towels changed every day.Just what you'd expect from this type of hotel. Breakfast was fine - I tried it once. As usual, however, it's cheaper and more fun to find a local cafe - there are loads in this area. Although I'm making this place sound soul-less - it's not. It's absolutely fine and very efficient/professional but not much 'Character' - although all the staff I met were very friendly and helpful. Mind you, I'd complement a park bench in Barcelona!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent value”
Reviews.Author: chicken_parma
Reviews.Content: A really good location, around 5 minutes from Plaza de Catalunya, and just off the top section of the Ramblas. Great tapas places are just around the corner from this hotel, and its very close to the Gaudi museums. The hotel itself is fairly bland, but for the price its good value. Rooms are a decent size and well fitted/equipped. Breakfast seemed very overpriced, especially as there are so many places nearby where you can get a coffee and a croissant for under 5 euro's (versus the 20 euro hotel buffet). All in all, a decent, business-like hotel. Great value for the location, but not a hotel that will knock your socks off.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Nefeli00
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel after its renovation. We had a very pleasant stay. Our room was great and always clean, the staff was very friendly, the breakfast was nice and the location perfect! We definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Locations”
Reviews.Author: Uncle3458
Reviews.Content: It may not be a 4 or 5 star hotel but if a great location, clean room and friendly staff are what you are looking for this is a good choice. I got a small but nice 8th floor single room with an unusual feature - a private patio on the roof ! It is in walking distance of a lot of tourist areas and very close to Metro. I would definitely consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Tourist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lushley
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 49 of our staff and I have to say I was pretty impressed with the value for money. The location is fairly central (quick stroll to Placa Catalunya) and the rooms were clean and had all the usual amenities. Mini bar was expensive, but that's to be expected in any hotel. We were lucky enough to have a top floor room with a spacious balcony at the back of the hotel. Others had rooms at the side of the building and the balcony was only big enough for one person to step outside for a cigarette. Breakfast was cold buffet style with plently of healthy options and was served untill 11.00 am which was good for those of us with hangovers from the night before! I would definitely stay here again, due to the location and price alone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - average”
Reviews.Author: CosmoTripGirl
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short three night stay. This hotel is fairly average in relation to decor and staff. We had to pay on arrival which I found strange. The location is great in that it is central to all landmarks and has a metro nearby. It was situated a couple of minute walks from Las Ramblas and in a nice part of town. The rooms are small and basic..ask for a room at the back as I imagine the rooms are at the front are noisy. Its situated on a busy street. I would go back as it was in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Good base hotel for exploring”
Reviews.Author: smeni06
Reviews.Content: City break, hotel base good for exploring. Taxi driver had trouble finding it, though, from information we had when booking - he had to ask someone in the end! Breakfasts quite good, but thought cost high 15 euros each, although if we had bought them on line when booking hotel, we were told 20 euros each - plenty of cafes nearby and we had excellent croissants and coffee for 4 euros for two people! Hotel rooms clean, but small and back rooms have no view whatsoever. No space to sit in room other than on the bed! Staff pleasant and helpful. Barcelona excellent break for weekend - try a tour on the tourist bus the first day, and see many of the sights before deciding what you want to go back to. Still trying to work out Metro though, not quite so easy to follow as London underground, but very clean and smart (not like London underground!)

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good Value at Hotel HCC Taber ,situated within easy reach of most areas of interest. Quiet room although somewhat small, hotel staff ,pleasant and helpful. Breakfast can be obtained nearby from variety of outlets. Good tips, tour bus ,excellent and midday set menu at maritime museum excellent food and value. A vibrant and interesting city

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position”
Reviews.Author: Jan05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 6 night break at the Taber. The hotel was clean, tidy and had everything we needed to make our stay enjoyable. La Rambla was just around the corner and all the tourist sites were within easy reach. Transport was excellent, both the tour buses and the Metro, but we still did a lot of walking (comfortable shoes are a must). The highlight of our holiday was the football at the Nou Camp - fantastic atmosphere and so safe. Barcelona is a must for people who love city breaks, and the hotel Taber can definetely be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for us”
Reviews.Author: 22ten
Reviews.Content: Thoughly enjoyed our short stay ( 3 nights) in this hotel. Location was very central for all the main attractions. We travelled from the airport and back by aerobus which if you don't have too much luggage is great. Therafter able to walk to most areas we wanted to see and to get tourist bus for round city tours. Hotel room was on 6th floor looking over main road but with double glazing onto balcony was pretty quiet. The hotel did have some building work going on but we saw no evidence of this. Room was well furnished and clean with fresh towels every day. Buffet continental breakfast was fine - only complaint was water to make coffee was in vacuum flasks which meant it was tepid but good selection for breakfast available. Would love to return to Barcelona and would consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We Had a Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: amylouise1986
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend & I stayed in this hotel last weekend, we went to Barcelona to see the football at the Nou Camp! We had a brilliant time, the hotel is pretty basic but its all you need for a few days away! The staff are all very helpful, anything you need they are there to help! All the rooms are very clean & they have everything you need in them....Mini Bar, shower, safe, etc.... The hotel is almost in the centre of the city.... the best way to travel is by the metro (very easy to use) this way you get to see all the city! We stayed for 2 nights & although we used the tube a lot, i have never walked so much in my life, so make sure you pack your walking shoes If you do decide to stay at this hotel, hope you have a great time! We certainley did!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 3 nights last week and it was lovely, they are having some construction work done but it didnt interfere with my stay at all. I would highly recommend this hotel as its 5 mins walk from the Placa Catalunya and the ramblas. Staff were friendly and the place was clean. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Dirty & Cold”
Reviews.Author: Molosk
Reviews.Content: We took our 22 month old son with us, booked a non smoking room and a cot. What we got was... A very old cot damaged and dirty, dirty curtains and carpet tiles which don't seem to have been cleaned for some time! The room was COLD and when we asked about heating, we were told it was "switched off". Under normal circumstances I could cope, but with a 22 month old baby it's just plain unacceptable. The hotel claims to have been refurbished recently, this is not evident. Staff were helpful but we didnt get what we asked for and we could not even bring ourselves to stay one night!

Reviews.Title: “no complaints with hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just back from 3 days in barcelona staying at the hotel taber. i feel i got what i paid for. great location, room and bathroom very clean, breakfast good and plentiful(apart from coffee being lukewarm) and staff helpful. a bit noisy from road outside but so exhausted from sightseeing this was not a problem. would stay here again
